properties.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 2 at 1:37AM PST until February 4 at 5:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a Beach
Hazards Statement, which is in effect through late Monday night.

* Surf...4-6 feet. Sets to 7 feet across southern San Diego
County.

* Timing...Surf building today, peaking early Monday morning,
subsiding late Monday night.

* Impacts...Strong winds and waves will cause dangerous rip
currents and hazardous swimming conditions. The strong winds and
large swell may result in localized flooding in low lying areas
and parking lots, along with local beach erosion.
properties.instruction:
A beach hazards statement is issued when threats such as strong
rip currents...elevated surf heights...minor tidal overflow...or
lightning are possible at local beaches.  Obey posted warning
signs and flags and talk to a lifeguard before swimming.  Use
caution when in or near the water and always swim near a
lifeguard.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
